clues.q: This home upgrade reduces heating and cooling needs the most.
clues.explain: Stopping heat loss/gain cuts energy demand at the source.

clues.q: LEDs save energy mainly because they waste less of this as heat.
clues.explain: LEDs convert more electricity into light instead of heat.

clues.q: This appliance often uses the most electricity because it runs 24/7.
clues.explain: Constant runtime beats small loads over time.

clues.q: Peak hours electricity is often dirtier. Shifting use is called this.
clues.explain: Using energy off-peak can lower grid emissions and cost.

clues.q: Home air leaks are found with this simple test using a fan.
clues.explain: It depressurizes the home to reveal leaks.

clues.q: Meals built around these protein-rich plants have a low footprint.
clues.explain: Plant proteins have much lower emissions than beef.

clues.q: Replacing beef with this poultry often cuts meal emissions by ~50–80%.
clues.explain: Ruminant methane is the big difference.

clues.q: Keeping food here (not the warmest shelf) reduces spoilage waste.
clues.explain: Cooler zones preserve food longer, reducing waste.

clues.q: This label date is about best quality, not safety, and leads to waste.
clues.explain: Use your senses; many foods are safe after the date.

clues.q: Composting returns nutrients to soils and cuts this landfill gas.
clues.explain: Anaerobic decomposition in landfills emits methane.

clues.q: Replacing a short car trip with this human-powered mode saves most.
clues.explain: Short trips have high cold-start emissions.

clues.q: Driving style with gentle acceleration is called this.
clues.explain: Smoother speed saves fuel.

clues.q: Combining errands into one loop is called this.
clues.explain: It reduces cold starts and distance.

clues.q: Public transport emissions per person are lower due to this effect.
clues.explain: More riders spread fixed emissions.

clues.q: Keeping tires at this level improves efficiency and safety.
clues.explain: Reduces rolling resistance and wear.

clues.q: This thin plastic type is often not accepted curbside.
clues.explain: Needs special drop-off; tangles sorting machines.

clues.q: Using a reusable water bottle prevents this upstream impact.
clues.explain: Prevents extraction and manufacturing emissions.

clues.q: This metal is a recycling champion—saves ~95% energy vs. new.
clues.explain: Recycling aluminum is very energy efficient.

clues.q: Placing items in the wrong bin is called this.
clues.explain: It can spoil loads and increase costs.

clues.q: Fixing items instead of replacing them is called this movement.
clues.explain: Extends product lifespans and cuts waste.

clues.q: Shorter ones of these save hot water and energy.
clues.explain: Less time = less water heated.

clues.q: This fixture’s leaks can waste hundreds of liters per week.
clues.explain: Silent leaks add up quickly.

clues.q: Native or drought-tolerant plants reduce this outdoor demand.
clues.explain: Landscaping choices matter in dry regions.

clues.q: Collecting this from roofs for gardens is called this.
clues.explain: Reduces tap water use and runoff.

clues.q: Efficient washers and these showerheads cut water and energy.
clues.explain: Less water to heat and pump.

final.clue: This term describes ensuring climate benefits and burdens are shared fairly, with special care for vulnerable communities.
final.explain: Fair treatment and meaningful involvement of all people in climate solutions.
